name: John Thompson
presenting_complaint: I’ve been having some tightness in my chest.
Something doesn’t feel right in the middle of my chest.
I just feel this odd pressure here.
It came on suddenly and hasn’t gone away.

ice.ideas: I think it could be gas or anxiety.
ice.concerns: I’m scared it might be a heart attack.
ice.expectations: I want something to stop this pain.

exam_findings: Patient is anxious and clutching chest. BP 150/90 mmHg, HR 98 bpm, SpO₂ 94%. Cardio exam unremarkable.
investigation_findings: ECG shows ST elevation in V2–V5. Troponin levels are elevated. Chest X-ray appears normal.
closure_lines: Thank you doctor, I hope it’s nothing serious.
Will I need to stay in the hospital?
What do you think it is?
Do I need to stop working?
ending_cue: Thanks, doctor. That’s all for now.

feedback.summary: Good structure, covered major DDs, explained diagnosis well.
feedback.improvement: Include lifestyle advice and more safety netting.
